biography.summary: Bernard Sanders is an American politician serving as the United States Senator from Vermont since 2007. A prominent progressive figure and advocate for universal healthcare, climate action, and economic justice, he has been a leading voice for left-of-center policies in the Senate. Prior to his Senate tenure, he served in the U.S. House of Representatives (1991–2007) and was the mayor of Burlington, Vermont.
biography.early_life: Born on September 8, 1941, in Brooklyn, New York, Bernard Sanders grew up in a working-class family and became involved in civil rights and community organizing before pursuing higher education and a life in public service.
biography.education: Attended Brooklyn College and studied at the University of Chicago in political science and related fields.
biography.career: Sanders served as Mayor of Burlington, Vermont (1989–1991), was elected to the U.S. House of Representatives (1991–2007), and has served in the U.S. Senate since 2007. He is known for his long-running progressive agenda and grassroots organizing.
